explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 58degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2000) which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group III (UN#2265) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 445degC (ICSC, 2000)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2265)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 3,370mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 4,200mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol.1, 2002), 3,040mg/kg (SIDS (2004)), 3,000mg/kg, 3,920mg/kg, 4,000 mg/kg, 4,320mg/kg, 3,200mg/kg, 7,170mg/kg (EHC 114 (1991)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 4,390mg/kg, calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (dermal route) of 11,140mg/kg, 11,000mg/kg (EHC 114 (1991)), and 3,500mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 1 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "no irritation" from animal eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.8 (2005)). Accidental exposure to the substance caused skin irritation, according to some report.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (EHC 114 (1991)): 75-100% solutions cause severe eye irritation; mild reddening of the conjunctiva and moderate corneal damage are observed within 14 days of exposure in the area, where severe damage, mild degeneration of the surface and arterialization are observed. The substance is thus considered "severely irritating" to the eyes.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory Sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin Sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (performed based on the maximization method) (EHC 114 (1991)) - Negative. However, classification is not possible, with only one set of data showing "negative" available.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.8 (2005).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC 71 (1999), Category A4 by ACGIH-TLV (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.8 (2005): Malformations (cleft palate, exencephalia, hydrocephalus, absence of sphenoid bone, fused ribs, absence of a tail, etc.) are observed in offspring at dose levels not toxic to parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "eating disorder, vomiting, pains in the abdominal/pelvic/femoral regions, hepatic fibrosis and aggregated histiocytes (after the disappearance of the symptoms)" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.8 (2005)), and the evidence from animal studies including "hypertrophy of the walls of the alveoli (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.8 (2005))" The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "hepatic function disorder, symptoms of alcohol intolerance (IRIS (1990)); hepatopathy, an increase in AST/ALT levels, focal hepatocyte necrosis, fatty degeneration of the microvesicles of the agranular endoplasmic reticulum. And based on the evidence from animal studies including: hypertrophy of centrolobular hepatocytes" (NTP TOX22 (1992)), "symptoms suggesting acute hepatocyte damage, an increase in SGPT/SGOT activity, histopathological changes in the liver of a young animal" (IRIS (1990)), "an increase in ALP activity" (over 100ppm), "an increase in ALT activity" (over 200ppm) "hepatocyte necrosis" (over 200ppm) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.8 (2005)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50>100mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (1995) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =1.00*106mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
